page.title: 10BAKER'S MILL GRT.C.
page.content: Bakers Mill was built in 800 AD. The mill was mentioned in the Domesday Book. In 1850 when the Baker family owned the mill they built extra parts to the mill. In 800 AD the lord of the Manor lived in Abbas Hall. Most of the flour was taken to the lord. In 1086 the Mill only had two or three workers now there are 105 workers. In 1970 they finished making flour. The Bakers now make cat and dog food and also farm animal food. The workers put soya,fish meat,wheat and maize in the mix for the cat food, and wheat,dried meat for the dog food. The extruder is something like a pressure cooker it has a shape at the back and the dog food goes through this shape and into plates and is then dried. Then, when it is dried, the dog and cat food is put into packets.
